inn1.comm: definite swing first up, tailing in through the air. Taylor pushes slightly too early and the ball goes uppishly, but falling safely, towards mid-on.
this wobbles the other way ... but starts too far from off and goes further. Called wide
great line from Razzaq, on off stump. Taylor's not sure which way the ball's going so he's got to prop forward in defence. Past the outside edge
well, what timing! That was just a firm push to cover, but it's beaten the fielder to the boundary. Back of a length, Taylor stood tall and punched, finding the gap. Taylor's away
big appeal! That has hooped in through the air, but strikes Taylor above the knee roll. Not out
Kamran's caught one! huge blow for Zimbabwe, Taylor falls. He walked forward into a drive, pushing his hands out at an outswinger. A thick edge nestles safely in the keepers' gloves
full, moving gently in. Taibu presses forward to defend
outswinger from Gul to start, too wide of the stumps to be of any danger and Reggie leaves alone
this one's gone out again, until it passes the batsmen, at which point it goes the other way. Good take from Kamran ...
bang on target, on a length and aimed at off stump. Chakabva defends
accurate start from Gul, zoning in on a length and again Chakabva defends
a touch fuller this time, this didn't move too much through the air but seamed in off the pitch. Forward defence from Chakabva

There's another one! Wrapped right infront of leg stump and he's given out. Chakabva thinks about the review - it could well have been slipping down leg with the movement and on the angle -  but decides against it. Zimbabwe in early trouble here
cautiously played by Taibu, pressing well forward. The ball takes a thick inside edge, rolling through square leg ... and a slightly comical misfield allows them back for the third
bang on a length, but defended solidly enough by Sibanda
this has jagged viciously off the seam, coming back in to strike Sibanda on the pad
extravagant inswing, Sibanda comes forward with pad and bat together, and the steal a single as the ball rolls to leg. Half an appeal, but possibly bat on that
outswinger, watched very closely by Taibu as he taps to gully
pushed to mid-on, no run there
hitting the deck hard, the ball rises towards the top of off and is defended
fuller this time, attacking the stumps. Sibanda is slightly late and off-balance in defence, but survives
good-looking drive from Sibanda, threading a full ball through point with a square drive. Technically just about perfect
typical fast bowler's reply, digging it in very short. Sibanda may well have been expecting it, he ducked under in good time
yorker! Sibanda digs it out, and is immediately surrounded by the Pakistan fielders inside the ring. Plenty of chatter and pressure on the batsmen
good, full length inswinger. Sibanda lunges forward in defence
some width offered outside off, Taibu gets a good connection on the cut but picks out point
that's the length, fuller from Razzaq, and swinging in. Defended
fuller still, outside off. Taibu drives to mid-off without much timing
wider still, Taibu does the right thing and whips the bat up to leave
another drive from Taibu, timed slightly better but he can't find the gap
and shuffling defence to finish another tight over from Pakistan's seamers
both seamers are working up great rhythm and hitting good lengths here. Nice and full, inside edge on the defence

what a catch! Sibanda steps forward to defend, uncertain of which way the ball will wobble. It comes in on the angle but then jags away and bounces, taking a healthy edge and flying to first slip where Misbah tumbled to his right to pluck the ball out of thin air
angling across the left-hander on a good length, but wide of off and left alone
Umar is working up good pace here, but the extra pace has pinged off the bat and raced to the cover boundary here. Ervine just stepped into a drive, all timing there
a snorter of a bouncer! Ervine almost fell over backwards getting out of the way. Great direction on a brute of a short ball. Ervine's not the most comfortable against short bowling
another huge appeal! Is it for lbw or a catch? Leg-before I think, as the ball swung in and wrapped him on the pad. Possibly pitching outside leg, possibly missing leg. Not given.
a thick inside edge to a full length ball rolls down to fine leg, and they amble through for one
going across the left-hander, moving towards the slips through the air. Left alone
better directed, but the length is just as good. Ervine presses half-forward in defence
that's where Ervine scores so many of his runs at the start of his innings - down to third man. He presses forward and angles his bat, letting ball hit bat and playing with soft hands
a similar shot, but in mirror-image as Taibu runs it down too
great attacking line, wobbling around full on middle. Ervine defends
unplayable! Umar lands one on a length on off stump, and it spits off the surface and jags away. Taibu hangs his bat out in hope more than anything, and is lucky not to edge that
fuller, coming in this time. Driven to mid-on with straight bat and high left elbow
bouncer from Umar, it balloons over the diminutive Taibu. Not a wide though
slapped on the up through cover point! A brave shot, but it's positive at least and that's what Zimbabwe need. Taibu is carrying Zimbabwe's hopes now
straighter, and fuller. Taibu taps to mid-on with a loud "no!"
nice shot again from Taibu, not for the power in it, but for the way it's played. He comes well forward, eyes wide on the ball, and plays through midwicket for one. Safe runs
Taibu pushes his hands at a length ball, it goes down on the leg side and they sprint a quick single
a touch too short to get the ball moving, back of a length and Ervine drops it to leg
fuller, still not much movement for Riaz as Ervine comes forward to defend
just short of a good length again, Ervine stays deep and defends to leg
width offered by Riaz, Ervine stands tall and cracks to point, but straight to the fielder
nicely placed by Ervine, he steps forward and whips through a straight midwicket. The ball won't reach the boundary but they're back for the third
full and angling across, the ball hits the seam and comes back in, taking a thick inside edge as Ervine drives and rolling through square leg
nicely played by Taibu, forced through backward point
nice and straight, zoning in on off stump. Ervine defends
fuller, Razzaq attacks the stumps. Ervine responds the a perpendicular straight bat in defence
just short of a good length, Ervine gets across and defends to leg
pure class in that shot. In swinging conditions, against a new ball with his team in trouble, Ervine steps forward and caresses a cover drive through extra cover. A thing of aesthetic wonder
nasty, rising ball at little Taibu. He stands to his full height and defends it down from in front of his face
back of a length again, outside off. Taibu tries to force to cover but the ball comes off the splice
take that! Riaz goes full outside off and Taibu seizes on the opportunity, driving confidently up and over mid-off. A couple of bounces and over the ropes
rising outside off, Taibu angles the bat to get it down to third man
full, angling towards leg stump. Ervine clips quite neatly, but straight to the close midwicket fielder
length on off stump this time. Ervine drops it towards cover, but the fielders converge in a flash so there's no chance of a single
full and wobbling in on off stump, solid defence from Taibu
Taibu guides down to third man, but slightly uppishly through gully
ouch, Ervine's been pinged there. Length ball, jagging in to beat the bat. He's down and breathing heavily for a moment, and then gingerly lifting his legs
good leave from Ervine, to a ball leaving him around off stump
just about perfect line to the left-hander, close on off stump. Ervine defends

dropped by Misbah at first slip! It was full, outside off and nibbling away. Ervine went forward to drive, a thick edge flew to Misbah's right. He got the hands to it but it popped out. "You've just dropped the World Cup," Ervine tells him. Possibly.
tapped away square by Taibu, they take a gentle single
rising off a length outside off, Ervine cracks it nicely behind point, and third man runs around to clean up
Taibu is struck a painful blow on the glove! It was a short-ish, rising ball, and he didn't know what to do with it so just wore one

gone! The crucial wicket falls, Taibu's gone. The ball was fuller and he was trying to lift it over the off side. It hits the toe of the bat, however, looping to Afridi, who's run around from mid-off.
popping up from a length, Lamb defends slightly awkwardly to cover
wide of off, left alone
beaten on the outside edge! Ervine comes forward to drive, the ball nips past him but dies off the pitch and bounces in front of Kamran
straighter, Ervine defends
Razzaq is playing with Ervine's patience outside off here. This is fuller, slightly wider. Ervine has a close look and leaves alone
Ervine threads the gap at cover with a neat little punch, two fielders hare after it and ... interestingly both dive for it at the boundary. One of them manages to keep it inside the rope
half a foot outside off, Lamb leaves alone
inside edge! A loose waft from Lamb as the ball jags in, taking an inside edge and bouncing between batsman and his stumps. Close call
beaten outside off, perfect line from left-hander to left-hander
tapped into the gap to the left of mid-on, Ervine calls for the single immediately
full, just outside off. Lamb defends from the crease
Lamb perhaps slightly beaten for a bit of pace there, ball hitting bat outside off. A rueful smile from him
tapped into the leg side, they steal a quick single and there's Zimbabwe's 50
forced into the covers, but straight to the fielder so no run there
not the greatest start from him, a loopy full toss that Lamb accepts gladly and slams down the ground for his first boundary
much better, full outside off and spinning away. Played down to gully
this one rushes straight on and quickly, Lamb defends
slashed down to backward point, a diving fielder cuts it off but they commit to the run
wrong 'un straight away from Afridi to the left-hander, picked by Ervine and defended
tossed up well wide of off stump from over the wicket, Ervine leaves well alone
Lamb whips a short of length ball on the pads down to fine leg to pick up a couple
Riaz has been bowling a decent pace today, constantly in the low to mid 140s, this one is 141kph, on a length and heading for off, defended
shorter ball this time, angling across the batsman who is looking to tuck the ball from outside off towards leg, nowhere close to it

Lamb is down on the ground after being struck on the 'unmentionables', a short of length ball which Lamb hops and looks to clip the ball towards square leg, he misses and the ball hits him where it hurts most
short of length ball heading for off, the typical Wahab Riaz ball, blocked by Lamb
once again it's a similar ball, Lamb looks to defend that but gets a bit of an inside-edge towards the leg side
fullish ball, Lamb paddles it towards fine leg, didn't try to get much power on that
straighter one, Ervine doesn't read it and is beaten outside off
defended towards the off side by Ervine

chance of a run out, but that was a terrible effort from Wahab Riaz, Ervine tucked the ball towards short fine leg and set off belatedly for a single, he was only halfway down the crease when Riaz threw the ball toward Afridi at the non-striker's end, but the throw was so wide that Afridi had no chance of stopping that, and what's more there is an overthrow as well
defended off the front foot to the off side
edge and that drops short, length ball on off, played tentatively off the back foot, takes the edge towards first slip and it lands just short of the waiting Younis at first slip

much more confident this time, opens the face to steer the ball towards deep backward point, where some more amateurish fielding, this time by Abdur Rehman, gives away some extra runs, he slides feet first towards the ball at the boundary but can't stop it
outside off, short of length and that batsman leaves it to the keeper
this one slants in after pitching back of a length, jags in to get an inside-edge on to the pads
on the pads, clipped behind square leg for a single
wide outside off, left alone
what was he trying there? a reverse-sweep  that he wanted to get fine, edges it onto his pads
length ball on the pads, defended to the leg side
that's the dangerous ball, it was an offbreak from Afridi, not the googly, turns big and the batsman is fooled by it, can't get bat on it
swept this time by Ervine, dangerously close to a diving Younis Khan at backward square leg, lands wide of him though and runs away for four
defended by Ervine

a review after the umpire turns the lbw down, that pitched well outside leg stump, so that review has been wasted, Kamran had suggested that it was pitching outside, but Pakistan decided to go for it anyway
Rehman starts with a length ball outside off, slapped towards point
the paddle-sweep again, a fullish ball outside off, played well but not sure it is worth the risk for just a couple, given that deep fine leg is in place
full and outside off, carved towards deep backward point for a couple
works it behind square on the leg side
some turn for Rehman, and bounce as well, left alone outside off
solid from Lamb, gets forward and blocks it
length ball outside off, defended
is that a drop? hard to say, but I think there was no edge, Ervine was looking to slap that to square leg, a shortish ball on leg, Akmal moved across but couldn't catch it
defended off the front foot to the off side
worked towards point for a single
more defence off the front foot
'well bowled,' shouts Kamran, as Lamb pushes a length ball from Afridi towards mid-off to complete the over
solidly defended off the front foot
more consistent bowling from Rehman, on a length and outside off, blocked by Ervine
fuller this time on the pads, whipped towards wide mid-on
swept powerfully to deep backward square leg
another sweep, all along the ground, again deep square leg does the fielding
flighted delivery, lashes it off the front foot towards wide long-on, 'Two,' is call from the batsmen, and they scamper through
outside off, dabbed towards short third
works it towards short fine leg, no run again
slides straight on, a length ball outside off, pushed in front of point
length ball on offstump, solidly defended on the front foot

there's the wicket, a googly that wasn't picked up by the batsman, a short of length ball that comes in after pitching outside off, batsman goes for the booming drive, inside-edged and ends up popping it back to the bowler, Afridi has his first
this one also slides into the batsman, quick delivery as well, defended
fullish ball on middle and leg, blocked towards the bowler
full and outside off this time, defended off the front foot towards cover
a bit of flight, slightly shorter, blocked towards cover
length ball on off, this has been a good over from Rehman so far, defended
more flight, spins a bit and that is defended off the back foot
outside off, and Chigumbura pushes it towards point, Kamran shouts 'Well bowled' for the sixth time this over
bit of width and that is enough for the batsman to carve it to deep backward point
length ball is pushed towards cover
streaky, it was the legspinner, Ervine looks to defend off the front foot, gets the outside edge,  but there is no first slip and Ervine gets four
massive appeal for caught behind, there was a sound before Kamran collected the ball outside off, but replays show the ball was well wide of the outside edge
the Afridi wrong 'un nearly spoils Chigumbura's birthday, batsman doesn't read it, gets an inside-edge that squirts past the legstump
punched off the front foot towards mid-off
stifled shout for lbw as Ervine defends to the off
blocked back to the bowler
swept towards square leg for a single
good use of the feet from Chigumbura, but he can't get a run, dances down and pushes the ball back to the bowler
gets a good stride in and drives confidently, can't beat Afridi at cover
length ball outside off, driven powerfully towards cover
short and wide, slapped hard towards deep backward point, smartly fielded by Hafeez near the boundary
Gul is right on target after the 99-minute break, a length ball on middle and off, defended by Chigumbura
good pace from Gul, 147.6 kph, has Chigumbura fishing outside off, beaten
length ball on the pads, tucked towards midwicket for a quick single
back of a length ball, in the channel outside off, defended off the back foot towards point by Ervine
length ball on the pads, clipped towards midwicket for a single
on the pads again, Ervine can't get it away past square leg
and that's his half-century, second in World Cups, and third in his one-day career, and Zimbabwe's hundred comes up as well, all those milestones came up through a punch past extra cover
spin and bounce for Rehman, turns in sharply and hits Ervine on the thigh pad
blocked off the front foot towards the off side
a confident sweep from outside off sends the ball towards deep backward square leg
Hafeez begins with a flighted and full ball on the pads, pushed towards midwicket
over the wicket for the right-hander, length ball, Chigumbura sashays down the the track and punches the ball to long-on

end of Ervine, bowled him, that one kept a touch low and Ervine looks to cut, he misses and the ball crashes into middle and off, absolutely no footwork from Ervine, he is caught in the crease by a delivery he should have been forward to, he pays the price, Pakistan are delighted
Utseya punches this one towards mid-on
length ball on offstump, defended to the leg side
lap-swept by Utseya towards short fine leg for a single
full and on the pads, tucked towards square leg, Utseysa wanted a single but the captain sent him back as Misbah was quickly onto the ball
defended to the off side
blocked back towards the bowler, Pakistan zipping through their overs
a length ball is eased to the left of the diving bowler, to long-off for a single
quicker one on the pads, nudged towards deep square leg
length ball on off, circumspect defence to end the over
length ball outside off, punched back to the bowler
keeps it steady, on off and middle, worked to the leg side
goes straight on this one, outside off, guided towards backward point
looks to drive this one firmly down the ground, gets an outside edge towards backward point
solidly driven off the front foot towards mid-on
length ball, heading straight for off, defended cautiously

a mix-up, but think the batsman has made his ground, third umpire called for, Utseya pushed the ball towards cover and set off for a run, sent back by the captain, Afridi does some fancy footwork before picking up the ball and throwing it to the keeper, that gives Utseya time to make a desperate lunge which takes him home
worked behind square leg for a single
blocked off the front foot towards the off side
slightly shorter from Hafeez, punched back to the bowler

on the pads, helped towards short fine, non-striker was in a tearing hurry, which meant the fielder had to aim at the non-striker's end to try get Chigumbura out, enough time to complete a tight single
pushed towards long-off for a single
length ball on offstump, nudged towards square leg
short of length, batsman comes down the track and drives the ball towards long-on
outside off, solidly punched towards long-off to get the third single of the over
length ball on offstump, steered towards square leg
a touch short on middle and leg, defended off the back foot
length and well outside off, more careful defence from Zimbabwe
still the spinners continue, fired down the leg side, Akmal moves quickly across to collect that
looked to dab towards midwicket, edged onto the pads, and the ball dribbles to the leg side, Akmal races out, picks up and throws down the stumps at the non-striker's end, run is taken though
defended to the off side
off the pads towards square leg for a single
shorter and on the pads, whipped towards deep square leg
flighted, slower ball, on a length outside off, blocked to the off side
short of length and just outside off, neatly dabbed past the keeper for four, that would have been gobbled up by first slip but there isn't one
superb delivery from Gul, 143 kph at the batsman's throat, batsman wasn't sure how to play that, somehow gets bat on it, ball rolls to the leg side and they steal a single
full and speared into leg stump, clipped to deep square leg for a single
length ball is driven towards mid-off, another sharp single is pinched, good work this from Zimbabwe
short of a length and outside off, steered away adeptly towards third man, make that eight off the over so far
good ball to end the over, a steepling  bouncer, 140kph, batsman gets the bottom hand off the bat as he fends at it, the ball rolls towards short third man for another single
inside-edge saved him, else that was a goner, in front of middle a length ball
hurries the batsman into defending that leg stump ball
didn't know much about that, edged on to his back leg
makes room and cuts a length ball on off towards backward point
guides this one towards cover to get one more run
short and strays onto the pads, glanced to short fine, and the batsmen continue to scamper well between the wickets to pinch a single
length ball on middle, driven towards mid-on for a single
short of length ball and outside off, controlled dab towards third man for a single
gets this one away to deep backward square leg for another single
what a bouncer that is, 142.3kph, on offstump, batsman weaves away and barely manages to get bat on it, the ball loops towards the vacant gully area, Gul wonders how that didn't fetch him a wicket
a legstump yorker that is dug out towards square leg, Gul has overstepped
ambitiously attempts to scoop that over his shoulder, doesn't get hold of that full delivery and the ball dribbles towards short fine
close to off Chigumbura just dabs it and the ball goes wide of third man for a couple
a full toss on middle is slapped to long-on
tossed up, full on middle , driven to long-off for a single
wide of offstump, carved towards sweeper cover
worked towards cover by Chigumbura but can't find the gap
Smash! ungainly shot but effective, gets down on his knee and hammers that fullish ball with a flat bat past long-on for four
blocked towards the off side, think of a single before deciding against it
that was quick, 145kph, on a length outside off, swing and a miss
a near yorker on middle, batsman gets his feet out of the way and tucks the ball towards mid-on for a single that brings up the 150
gets the batsman's toes this time, a yorker outside legstump, hurt the batsman, who jogs through a leg bye as the ball rolls towards short fine leg

a second catch for Akmal, a short ball from Gul, Utseya goes for the pull, top-edges the high-speed delivery, and it pops up towards backward square leg, it's in the air long enough for Akmal to race across and pouch it

inn2.comm: outswinger to start, pitched up to the bat on off stump. A loosener from Masakadza, and it's driven into the covers
huge appeal! That looked like it was heading near to the leg stump ... they think about the review, but looked like it was going down to be honest
swinging away on a good length outside off, left alone
pace, bounce and carry from Masakadza! That took off outside off, swinging away. Another leave from Hafeez
full, shaping away, slapped hard to point who gets his body behind the ball
good, tight over! He hits a length on off stump, and Hafeez can only defend to cover. That's a maiden
on target to start, and it's defended to leg. Price follows through most of the way down the wicket to have a quiet word in Shehzad's ear
full on middle and leg, flicked to the square leg fielder
nudged to short fine leg this time
steady forward defence from Shehzad
a touch too short from Price, but he escapes as it's slapped straight to cover
Shehzad is away! Lovely shot, skipping down the wicket, getting right to the pitch and lifting the ball cleanly over mid-off. One bounce.
well, there's your answer. Masakadza slips onto leg stump and is elegantly glanced in the air out to deep midwicket
that's a much better line, just outside off and swinging away. Left alone
Shingi tries the bouncer, but he doesn't quite have the pace to hurry Hafeez, who rocks back to pull him to deep square, where the fielder collects on the bounce
bad ball, speared down the leg side. He was, perhaps, expecting it to swing out again, but it just went on with the angle
that's much too short, dug in at his own feet and the bouncer balloons way over the batsman
a bit of indecision in the running as the ball hits the pad and trickles into the leg side... eventually they decide against a run
nice ball, good length and swinging away. It's cautiously watched and left alone
slashed up and over the two slips, and third man won't stop that! It was a poor ball, too short and too wide, and Shehzad just threw the bat at it
full and straight, defended to close midwicket
arrowed down the leg side, too far though and that's wide
tapped down to long-on, easy run
hurled down on a very flat trajectory, clipped to backward square

gone! Stumped by metres! This one was looped up much slower, Shehzad sprinted out at it and tried to smash it into the Indian Ocean. Taibu has the bails off in a flash, and that's just what Zimbabwe wanted
drifting in and rushing on with the arm, defended. Price charges down with wild eyes and welcomes Asad to the crease
a touch short, Shafiq steps back and pushes to mid-off
good line, good length. Hafeez defends, with a hint of inside edge. This is all Zimbabwe need from Masakadza, just keep it nice and tight and let the batsmen try and force something
bah, and he follows it up with a wide
confusion! Hafeez tapped to cover and half set off for a run ... he's sent back just in time
short again, and Hafeez smacks this one even harder than he did the last. Ervine dives at long leg, but he can't stop it
that's put away through the off side! After the bouncer, Shingi dishes it up short and wide outside off
this time he hits the right length, the ball spits off the pitch and strikes Hafeez a painful blow on the gloves. Ouch
too full this time, Shingi is all over the place here. Hafeez picks the half volley and sends it straight back, all along the ground and to the boundary. Nice shot
speared at leg stump, off the pad to short fine leg
fuller and closer to off stump, defended to cover
slightly slower through the air, the ball turns a touch. Shafiq defends
quicker, arm ball. More defence. More stares from Razor
off the inside edge this time as Shafiq defends off the front foot yet again. Price is excited
and defended gently back down the track to complete the over - a maiden
tossed up beautifully just outside off, defended
tossed up even slower, this one holds its line and is squeezed away off a bit of a leading edge
tapped back to the bowler
defended to that short midwicket
looped up really nice and slow again, Hafeez doesn't take the bait
slightly too straight, off the pad but straight to short fine leg
too short from Price, but he's not punished as the pull goes straight to square leg
speared at leg stump, off the pad to fine leg
tossed up outside off, driven hard into the ground. The ball bounces over a diving cover fielder, but mid-off runs around to keep it to one
nudged into the leg side. This is wonderfully tight stuff from Price, giving them nothing
this looked slower through the air, and just gripped a touch on the surface. Defended
utterly solid forward defence to finish, this batting wouldn't be out of place in a Test match
looped up yet again, it's just a touch too full though and he's driven down the ground
gently lobbed into the breeze by Utseya, hovering for a moment in the cool night air. The ball is defended to leg
the arm ball? Cracked to cover
leading edge! He closed the face far too early on this one, and a leading edge looped towards cover. Dropping safe though
nudged into the leg side, no runs there
perhaps just a shade too short from Utseya, Shafiq tries to force it away through the covers but hits the fielder
landing on middle and leg, turned to short fine
loose start from Lamb, this was far, far too short and easily cut away to the point boundary
tossed up straighter, still not quite full enough though. Nudged to square leg for a single
tapped into the off side, mid-off runs in
nudged into the gap square on the leg side, just the one
pushed to cover off the back foot
flicked to midwicket, but straight to the fielder
Shafiq backs away, trying to manufacture width. Punched straight to mid-off
too full on middle, driven to long-on
this flight is so tempting, it should come with an R18 age restriction. Tapped back to the bowler
driven into the leg side, but straight to wide mid-on
driven down the ground, and a single to end the over
too straight from Lamb, easily worked away to deep square leg
again, landing on middle and leg. Lamb hasn't quite found the right line here
eased down the ground, there's another single
a long-hop as Lamb slips in the quicker one, but fortunately for him its tapped straight to square leg. Some confusion in the running, but nothing major
eased down the ground
defended off the front foot, back to the bowler
and perhaps that's why he's slipped this one in a bit short. Shafiq is quickly into position, cutting it away with precision
slightly too short again, and flat through the air. He should go back to flighting them. Cut away into the deep, where there is now protection
tossed up on middle, clipped out to midwicket
nudged to leg, another single
that's more like it, flighted on middle and off
Prosper gives me hot flushes when he does it like that ... this one had a good three or four seconds of hang time before it hit the turf. Nudged to the midwicket fielder
pitched up, the ball is fetched from outside off and clipped into the leg side
that's the way, much slower through the air and the ball is dropped to gully
turned round to fine leg
cracked off the back foot, straight to cover
Hafeez turns the bat round the front pad, and they get a single as the ball goes to fine leg's left
flighted again, driven down to long-on
nice start, tossed up on middle. Not much turn at all, the ball sliding on
too short this time, a touch of turn away but it's slapped out to deep cover
drifting in through the air, but again not much spin. Defended back down the track
looped up gently again, plenty of revs on the ball so it moves in a touch, but not much off the wicket
eased away off the back foot out to deep point
landing on leg stump, this turn offer a hint of turn. Dropped to leg, Shafiq wants a run but he's sent back
hesitation in the running again, but it doesn't cost them even though the fielder runs in and hits the stumps directly, underarm
tossed up high outside off, turned to midwicket
nudged to square leg, right between the two fielders and this time the call for the run is immediate and confident
chipped in the air out to deep square leg, but there's a fielder out there
whipped off the pads, out into the deep on the leg side
delicate! He waited and waited on this one, angling it away from the off stump at the last moment with a deft little late cut. Three runs the result
Cremer is starting to find a little turn now, this one lands on leg and turns to middle. Defended
pushed slightly further down leg, off the pad to short fine
Shafiq presents the full face of the bat and drives down to long-on
wonderfully flighted on middle by Cremer, Hafeez defends to cover
Hafeez stays deep in the crease and punches out to cover point
landing on middle and leg, defended back down the track
much too short from Lamb, cracked away very hard out to deep cover but Ervine hauls it in
flicked to backward square leg, the fielder runs round to cut it off
eased down to long-on

too short again, Lamb is struggling to find the right length and this is pulled powerfully away. The spinners are starting to struggle with this wet ball, everyone's got a cloth tucked into their trouser
looped up very slow, driven hard but straight back to the bowler
Shafiq waits on the back foot and forces this one down to long-on
driven back towards the bowler, Cremer dives to his left but can't stop it, down to long-off
flighted on leg stump, the ball drifts in and strikes the pad. Heading way down leg
flapped away, in the air, down to long on
slightly flatter trajectory, outside off, and driven to cover
nudged behind square, they steal a quick single
Cremer strays down leg and is powerfully swept away ... a diving Masakadza saves four at long leg
overpitched and outside off, Shafiq looks to carve that past cover, can't find the gap
length ball on off, punched back to the bowler
superb drive from Shafiq, just overpitched by Masakadza, Shafiq latches onto it, gets forward and crunches it on the up and past extra cover, a very good looking shot that
on middle and off this time, opens the face to steer the ball towards point
every now and then Masakadza comes up with a beauty like this one, swings away a touch after pitching short of a length outside off, has Shafiq wafting at it in vain
very short, and very high outside off, great bounce but too much to be a legal delivery, that's a wide
back of a length, good line, on off, punched off the back foot towards cover, Shafiq sets off for a single, sent back, easily back in time
length ball on middle and leg, defended to the off side
fired down the leg side, another wide, Zimbabwe can't give away these freebies

length ball, horribly mistimed as he goes for the lofted inside-out hit, the ball doesn't turn as much as the batsman expects, so the ball goes a lot straighter off the bat than Shafiq intends, lands short of long-off, when he was aiming at deep extra cover
poked towards point for a single
nudged off the pads towards square leg for one more

nicely flighted, what an outstanding shot that is, when Hafeez is in form, he looks like a great batsman, it was slightly overpitched, and Hafeez gets forward and caresses that with minimal effort through cover for four
length ball, spinning after pitching on middle and leg, Hafeez backs away and pushes the ball towards cover for a single
fired down the leg side, and that's another wide
short of length and heading for legstump, defended down the track
slants it towards leg, worked behind square leg off the front foot
can't beat the man behind square leg this time
length ball on the pads, sensibly worked to long-on for a single
Hafeez will have to wait for his eight half-century as this ball is darted into legstump, defended to the leg side
solidly defends the final ball of the over
overpitched outside off, swept towards short fine leg for a single
no fifty for Hafeez, he edges a length ball outside off and Price pouches a low, sharp catch at first slip, Utseya is ecstatic, sets off a celebratory dance
sweeps the first ball towards fine leg to get a couple that brings up the century for Pakistan
swept again, from outside off towards square leg for a single
bit of width, Shafiq aims a powerful cut, gets a thick top edge that flies over first slip, a long chase for short third man
full and wide, Afridi wants to send that screaming over cover, doesn't connect though

Pakistan don't want to hang around any more, it was a quick ball just outside off, Shafiq makes some room and powers that behind backward point for four, a risky shot that, but comes off this time for Shafiq
full and on the pads, tucked to square leg for a quick single, two men around square leg but they can't stop the run

end of Afridi, the move to push him up the order hasn't worked, Price is enjoying himself, Afridi moves beyond leg and looks to crash the ball through the off, he misses as the ball from Price jumps up sharply to crash into the off bail
a length ball outside off, defended off the back foot
stopped in his run-up, a couple of steps before delivering the ball, then sends the ball down leg
this one is blocked back to Price, who collects the ball after sprinting to his right and then mimes throwing down the stumps
nudged behind square leg by Younis, still to get off the mark
length ball on middle, tucked towards square leg
spins away after pitching on a length outside off, dabbed towards short third man
dabbed behind square leg for a single
Younis nearly chips it back to the bowler, he was looking to flick that to midwicket, ends up nearly popping a simple caught and bowled
length ball on offstump, nudged to square leg for a single, which was taken after a bit of confused calling
on the pads, gets deep in the crease and works the ball towards square leg for a single
a hint of flight, length ball heading for leg, defended off the front foot
length ball on the pads, punched off the back foot towards mid-on
length ball on off, clipped towards midwicket for a single
length ball on the pads, looks to glance it, off the pads towards square leg
whips it off his pads towards square leg but can't get the runs
length ball, on offstump, crunched down towards long-on for a single
powered down the ground, not very pretty, a short ball is flat-batted back, Greg Lamb hurtles across from long-on for a single
pushed towards cover
length ball on off, pushed towards mid-off
length ball on middle, easily worked down to long-on for a single
gets well forward and looks to drive, takes the outside edge though, and flies past the vacant slip towards short third
short ball that turns in, mistimed drive towards mid-off
round the wicket, on a length, defended by the batsman
shorter this time, and outside off, attempts a powerful cut, can't connect
length ball on middle, opens the face to steer the ball towards backward point
short of length ball on middle, Younis rocks back and eases the ball towards mid-off
Shafiq gets to his half-century, a composed innings from the youngster, tucking the ball off his pads towards square leg
down the leg side, guided to short fine, but can't beat the man in the circle
on the pads again, tucked towards the square leg
length ball on the pads,edged towards square leg
keeps it on legstump, Younis gets back in the crease and guides the ball towards square leg
length ball outside leg, backs away and cracks the ball towards point
length ball on legstump, tucked towards square leg
makes room and looks to cut but can't connect
a legspinner, batsman moves across the stumps and whips the ball in front of square leg
length ball outside off, reaches across and punches the ball towards cover
short of a length ball, Shafiq comes down the track and bludgeons the ball over the bowler's head for four
length ball well outside off, Shafiq reaches across and slashes that behind backward point for four more, Pakistan getting a move on

a life for Shafiq, fired into legstump, nudged towards square leg, Shafiq was yards out of his crease when the throw reached the bowler's end, the bowler couldn't collect the ball cleanly and break the stumps though, Shafiq survives
on the pads, tapped towards deep square leg, good placement that, and Younis pushes his partner to come back for the third
on the pads, glanced fine past short third
an uppish straight drive, Cremer dives towards his right but can't get his hand on the ball
defended towards midwicket by Younis
textbook forward defence from Younis
blocked towards the offside by Younis
short of length from Masakadza, defended towards the leg side
shortish and on off, defended off the back foot towards the off side, Shafiq wanted one Younis didn't, Shafiq turns back
that one just took off, astounding, Masakadza has got some deliveries to bounce sharply but that short ball was yards over the batsman's head, keeper had no chance either
steered the ball towards third man, where a fumble gives away an extra run
overpitched on middle, tucked towards deep midwicket for more runs
lovely stop from Ervine after Shafiq slaps the ball towards cover, a great dive stops the ball but Ervine spoils that by giving away an overthrow
a slower ball outside off, defended towards point
shortish from Price, Younis shuffles across and tucks it towards midwicket
short outside off, cuts it backward of point
drifting into the pads, worked to the leg side of the pitch
Price continues to peg away, Younis reaches out on off stump and dabs to the off side
dangled into the pads, dabbed away square for a single
again too straight, Younis eases it through midwicket for one more
over-pitched on off stump and punched crisply but straight to cover
now a full toss outside off, Shafiq is timing them quite well but mid-off does well to run across and field the fluent off drive
short and wide outside off, he hangs back and cuts it to third man for a single
legcutter on middle and off, Shafiq forces into the covers for one more

and Pakistan are through to the quarter-finals, this is their first successful chase in World Cups  since the 1999 semi-final against New Zealand, just outside off, Shafiq carves it past point for a boundary that brings up the victory
